intro: Ricinus viridis, commonly known as the green castor oil plant, is a species of flowering plant in the spurge family, Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its palmate leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces a toxic latex similar to other ricinus species, which contains ricin, a potent toxin. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Due to its toxicity, it requires careful handling and is not recommended for indoor cultivation without proper precautions.
